definition: to read silently/to mouth (the words of a prayer etc)/to say to oneself/to contemplate inwardly

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Read some meditations to your child or a favorite bedtime story before bed.
sentences.chinese: 睡前给他默念一些祷告或者他最喜欢的睡前故事。

sentences.english: Do you know when people recite the Sutra?
sentences.chinese: 你知道人们在什么时候默念真经？

sentences.english: Can I chant Amitabha Buddha silently?
sentences.chinese: 在厕所里可以默念佛号吗？

sentences.english: As they circle the clearing, they begin a murmurous chanting to their gods - who demand sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 他们清出空地，开始对他们祭祀的神默念起咒语。

definition: to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)
to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss
variant of 念念有詞|念念有词[nian4 nian4 you3 ci2]
to learn by heart/to commit to memory/to remember/to memorize in silence
silent contemplation/to meditate/to think in silence
